metadata.title: Integration of Marine Bird and Mammal Observations with the Pacific Ocean Continuous Plankton Recorder Program
metadata.description:
Along a 7500 km transect from Vancouver, British Columbia to Tokyo, Japan, counts of marine birds and mammals in relation to SST and SSS measurements and subsurface plankton communities. Individual sightings of birds and mammals records to the lowest
taxonomic level possible concurrent with latitude and longitude.
metadata.notes:
Purpose: Zooplankton and top predator communities are known to quickly respond to climate variability and change. This project is designed to examine seasonal, interannual, and possibly interdecadal variability in North Pacific Ocean and southern Bering Sea marine
ecosystems. This research will provide information on predator-prey associations (e.g., aggregative response) in water masses of varying characteristics. Information will be used by ocean government agencies and others for fisheries and wildlife management and conservation.

Status: In Progress

Maintenance frequency: Continually

Access constraints: Permission of Contributor required
